qas.question: Who lived in buildings that would later come to be known as the Presidential Palace?

answers.text: the Qing viceroy and the Taiping king

qas.question: When did Qing troops regain Nanjing?
How many people died during the Qing troops retaking of Nanjing?
Qing troops allowed no rebels who spoke what dialect to surrender?
Who was the leader of the Qing troops?

context: Both <a0_0>the Qing viceroy and the <a3_0>Taiping<a3_0/> king<a0_0/> resided in buildings that would later be known as the Presidential Palace. When Qing forces led by <a4_0>Zeng Guofan<a4_0/> retook the city in <a1_0>1864<a1_0/>, a massive slaughter occurred in the city with <a2_0>over 100,000<a2_0/> estimated to have committed suicide or fought to the death. Since the Taiping Rebellion began, Qing forces allowed no rebels speaking its dialect to surrender. This policy of mass murder of civilians occurred in Nanjing.
